objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: National Cyber Security Centre (author/publisher of this report). The report metadata and YARA rules list NCSC as author; the disclaimer and copyright indicate UK Crown / NCSC involvement.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND default C2
objects.description: Hardcoded default C2 IP present in sample; used as command-and-control infrastructure.

objects.name: umbrella stand
objects.description: A collection of actor binaries targeting FortiGate 100D series firewalls to enable persistent, long-term access. UMBRELLA STAND beacons to a configurable C2 using a fake TLS header on port 443 (no TLS handshake), uses AES-CBC encrypted C2 communications with a fixed IV/key in observed samples, supports remote shell execution (two implementations), configurable beacon frequency and configurable C2 IP, can read and exfiltrate file chunks, supports process injection via deployed tooling, can hook device reboot functionality and use ldpreload (libguic.so) for persistence, overwrites process cmdline to impersonate /bin/httpsd, hides files under /data2/.ztls/, and is deployed alongside public tooling such as BusyBox, nbtscan and tcpdump. Default hardcoded C2 IP observed: 89.44.194.32.

objects.name: shoe rack
objects.description: A previously unknown piece of malware identified on the same device as UMBRELLA STAND. The report notes it was present but its analysis is beyond the scope of this report; it is referenced as associated tooling on infected devices.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: Vendor/manufacturer of FortiGate 100D series firewalls; the report identifies those FortiGate 100D devices as the target platform for UMBRELLA STAND.

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
encrypted stack strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {C6 45 D0 92 C6 45 D1 48 C6 45 D2 D6 C6 45 D3 E3 C6 45
D4 39 C6 45 D5 EE C6 45 D6 CE C6 45 D7 E4 C6 45 D8 59 C6 45 D9 58
C6 45 DA 97 C6 45 DB E5 C6 45 DC 2E C6 45 DD 27 C6 45 DE 98 C6 45
DF DE C6 45 E0 93 C6 45 E1 A8 C6 45 E2 77 C6 45 E3 9B C6 45 E4 4A
C6 45 E5 F0 C6 45 E6 EF C6 45 E7 74 C6 45 E8 80 C6 45 E9 2D C6 45
EA EB C6 45 EB 30 C6 45 EC 1F C6 45 ED B5 C6 45 EE D9 C6 45 EF C7}
// Key
        $ = {C6 45 C0 77 C6 45 C1 90 C6 45 C2 3D C6 45 C3 35 C6 45
C4 A4 C6 45 C5 9F C6 45 C6 0F C6 45 C7 5E C6 45 C8 F5 C6 45 C9 52
C6 45 CA 44 C6 45 CB 69 C6 45 CC B9 C6 45 CD C0 C6 45 CE BA C6 45
CF DC} // IV
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings, if string obfuscation is not present."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {ED B8 83 20}
        $ = "%s/%d.sv"
        $ = "%s/%s.ini"
        $ = "%s>%s 2>&1"
        $ = "%[^=]=%[^=]"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/"
        $ = "/proc/%s/status"
        $ = "%*s %s"
        $ = "./lidwok killall blghtd"
        $ = "89.44.194.32"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/lidwok"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        5 of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings present in tooling."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "LoadMsg"
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "error"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies sample based on custom Base64 alphabet and
encryption key."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:

        $ = ",((@=+utivp45ztvo6&RFvt&*^tp&!q;"
        $ =
"ef345FGHIJKLMNOPWghijklmnoXYd67TUVABC89+/pqrstQRSDEZabcuvwxyz012"

    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies sample based on strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "dxumbsu"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "loadMsg"
        $ ="/SYSV64564856"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings used to configure injection."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/SYSV64564856"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "version 2"
        $ = "init_drivercheck"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains functionality to receive and run Shell commands.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains AES-encrypted strings which the malware deobfuscates/decodes at runtime.

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses tooling to perform process injection (e.g., using dskz to inject shared objects into init/processes).

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND binaries had been deleted from the device, indicating use of file deletion to remove artifacts.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Process Argument Spoofing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND modifies its process name on the command line to impersonate a legitimate process (overwriting cmdline with '/bin/httpsd').

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling use hidden directories (e.g., /data2/.ztls/) to conceal files and reduce detection likelihood.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Kernel Modules and Extensions
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to modify reboot behavior (reboot hooking) to achieve persistence across reboots.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses ldpreload (modifying /etc/ld.so.preload to load libguic.so) as a dynamic linker hijacking technique to load actor components into new processes.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND performs process discovery to check that its main process (blghtd) is still executing; a watchdog (jvnlpe) restarts it if not.

objects.name: Network Service Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was used in conjunction with nbtscan which can list NetBIOS computer names, indicating network service discovery activities.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was used in conjunction with tcpdump to perform packet captures on the device (network sniffing capability via deployed tooling).

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol or Service Impersonation
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses fake TLS headers/protocol impersonation for its C2 communications (sending TLS-like bytes but without performing a TLS handshake) to obfuscate and masquerade traffic.

objects.name: VirusTotal
objects.description: Threat-intelligence service referenced in the report (used for retro-hunt precision checks referenced in YARA rule descriptions).

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Umbrella Stand
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. umbrella stand.
